intro: Piptocephalum carpholepis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are succulent and can store water. Piptocephalum carpholepis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
